segment.source: Check In a GPO
segment.target: Check In a GPO

segment.source: Check In a GPO
segment.target: Check In a GPO

segment.source: Check In a GPO
segment.target: Check In a GPO

segment.source: Ordinarily, Editors should check in Group Policy objects (GPOs) that they have edited when their modifications are complete.
segment.target: Ordinarily, Editors should check in Group Policy objects (GPOs) that they have edited when their modifications are complete.

segment.source: (For details, see Edit a GPO Offline.) However, if the Editor is unavailable, an Approver can also check in a GPO.
segment.target: (For details, see Edit a GPO Offline.) However, if the Editor is unavailable, an Approver can also check in a GPO.

segment.source: A user account with the Editor, Approver, or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the Editor, Approver, or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To check in a GPO that has been checked out by an Editor
segment.target: To check in a GPO that has been checked out by an Editor

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: On the Contents tab in the details pane, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.
segment.target: On the Contents tab in the details pane, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.

segment.source: To discard any changes made by the Editor, right-click the GPO, click Undo Check Out, and then click Yes to confirm.
segment.target: To discard any changes made by the Editor, right-click the GPO, click Undo Check Out, and then click Yes to confirm.

segment.source: To retain changes made by the Editor, right-click the GPO and then click Check In.
segment.target: To retain changes made by the Editor, right-click the GPO and then click Check In.

segment.source: Type a comment to be displayed in the audit trail of the GPO, and then click OK.
segment.target: Type a comment to be displayed in the audit trail of the GPO, and then click OK.

segment.source: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.
segment.target: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.

segment.source: On the Controlled tab, the state of the GPO is identified as Checked In.
segment.target: On the Controlled tab, the state of the GPO is identified as Checked In.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and either Edit Settings or Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and either Edit Settings or Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.

segment.source: If you are not an Approver or AGPM Administrator (or other Group Policy administrator with Deploy GPO permission), you must be the Editor who has checked out the GPO.
segment.target: If you are not an Approver or AGPM Administrator (or other Group Policy administrator with Deploy GPO permission), you must be the Editor who has checked out the GPO.
